volop.name: Volunteer ESL Teacher - One month to three months
volop.description:
Volunteer ESL Teacher Opportunity at African Angels School, Chintsa East - A Safe Haven by a Stunning Beach!

Make a Meaningful Impact on Young Lives in a Secure and Beautiful Corner of the Eastern Cape!

African Angels School, a haven of quality primary education nestled in the safe and welcoming coastal community of Chintsa East, Eastern Cape, South Africa, is seeking a passionate and experienced English as a Second Language (ESL) teacher to join us as a volunteer.

About African Angels School:

We provide a nurturing and high-quality primary education to children from disadvantaged backgrounds in the local township. As a non-profit organization, our mission is driven by the desire to empower these young learners with sound values, crucial educational and life skills, insight, and strong character. By volunteering with us, you will directly contribute to breaking the cycle of poverty and opening doors to brighter futures for our students, all while experiencing the tranquility of a secure coastal environment.

The Opportunity:

We are seeking a dedicated volunteer to share their expertise and passion for the English language by teaching English as a Second Language to our primary school students. This is an incredible opportunity to:

  • Make a tangible difference: Directly impact the lives and educational journeys of eager young learners.
  • Utilize your skills for good: Apply your ESL teaching experience in a meaningful and rewarding context.
  • Immerse yourself in a vibrant community: Experience the warmth and culture of Chintsa East, known for its friendly locals and safe atmosphere.
  • Gain invaluable cross-cultural experience: Broaden your horizons and develop a deeper understanding of education in a different context.
  • Contribute to a vital mission: Support the ongoing efforts of African Angels School to provide quality education to those who need it most.
  • Enjoy a stunning location: Chintsa East boasts a breathtakingly beautiful and safe beach, offering opportunities for relaxation and rejuvenation during your time off. Imagine unwinding by the ocean after a fulfilling day of teaching!

We Are Looking For a Volunteer With:

  • Proven experience teaching English as a Second Language.
  • A strong understanding of ESL methodologies and engaging teaching techniques.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a patient and empathetic approach.
  • A genuine passion for teaching and working with children.
  • The ability to create fun, interactive, and effective ESL lessons for primary school students.
  • Cultural sensitivity and a willingness to learn about and respect the local context.

Accommodation

During the week you'll have your own room in our hostel.On weekends there are a variety of different accommodation options for you to choose from.

Watch our video to learn more: African Angels School
